As long as the jars are on the classpath, you can use the ClassLoader to
dynamically load any class that extends TestCase, I think.  But, the code to
do that is probably too involved to be TSTTCPW.  So instead, just unzip the
jar entries into a temp directory, and the temp directory to your classpath,
and do your sniffing.

-jason

    > Hi all.
    > 
    >   I'm working on a TestRunner that sweeps up all of the 
    > TestCases on the
    > class path into one TestSuite and then runs it, dumping 
    > the results
    > optionally to a file, System.out, or a gui.  This 
    > TestRunner could then be
    > used in automation and during development with a minimum of setup.
    >   ClassPathTestCollector does a great job of grabbing up 
    > the .class files on
    > the class path, but it doesn't dip into the jars to grab 
    > those classes also.
    > I'm about to write some code to add this functionality.  
    > Has anyone already
    > done this?  If so, could you share code, ideas, or suggestions?
    >   Thanks.
